body_html:
Hi - thanks for creating builds for Raspberry Pi - I'm from RPF and have a few questions:

  • why are they tagged with the any platform rather than linux_armv6l and linux_armv7l?
  • are you able to support the Python 3 version that ships with Raspbian, i.e. 3.5?

Also, I maintain the piwheels project (we build and host Armv6/7 wheels for Raspberry Pi of everything on PyPI - this) - would you be able to send new releases to me for inclusion on there? Alternatively we could build ourselves, like we do for opencv, provided the instructions are kept up-to-date.
body_text:
Hi - thanks for creating builds for Raspberry Pi - I'm from RPF and have a few questions:

why are they tagged with the any platform rather than linux_armv6l and linux_armv7l?
are you able to support the Python 3 version that ships with Raspbian, i.e. 3.5?

Also, I maintain the piwheels project (we build and host Armv6/7 wheels for Raspberry Pi of everything on PyPI - this) - would you be able to send new releases to me for inclusion on there? Alternatively we could build ourselves, like we do for opencv, provided the instructions are kept up-to-date.
body:
Hi - thanks for creating builds for Raspberry Pi - I'm from RPF and have a few questions:

- why are they tagged with the `any` platform rather than `linux_armv6l` and `linux_armv7l`?
- are you able to support the Python 3 version that ships with Raspbian, i.e. 3.5?

Also, I maintain the [piwheels](https://www.piwheels.org/) project (we build and host Armv6/7 wheels for Raspberry Pi of everything on PyPI - this) - would you be able to send new releases to me for inclusion on there? Alternatively we could build ourselves, like we do for opencv, provided the instructions are kept up-to-date.
